intro: Willughbeia treacheri, commonly known as the treacherous willughbeia, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Araliaceae, characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are typically pollinated by insects. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
